page.title: 20Conservation.
page.content: The West Dorset Heritage Coast includes all the coastline of this area with the exception of West Bay. The National Trust owns much of the coastal area of West Dorset, including the undercliffs to the east of Eype Mouth. Both of these organisations help to protect this coastline from unsightly developments resulting from tourism. From a natural history point of view the undercliffs west of West Bay are an important natural conservation area. Wild plants can grow and creatures can live with little human interference because of the regular landslips and cliff falls. The Dorset Coast Path follows the cliff top of this coastline and is regularly used throughout the year, but especially by tourists during the summer period.
